snippet: The Geneva-based owner of luxury brands like Cartier and Montblanc said its annual net profit rose 3 percent as tourists spent on watches and jewelry.
abstract: Swiss luxury goods conglomerate Compagnie Financiere Richemont reports modest rise in annual profit, with net earnings for the year to March 31 rising 3 percent to just over 2 billion euros, or $2.7 billion, amid a 5 percent increase in revenue, to 10.6 billion euros.
lead_paragraph: The Geneva-based owner of luxury brands like Cartier and Montblanc said its annual net profit rose 3 percent as tourists spent on watches and jewelry.

headline.main: European Sales Help Luxury Group Richemont Balance a Decline in Asia
headline.print_headline: Richemont Reports a Small Gain in Profit as Sales in China Fall
